body:
Jefferies Group reiterated their buy rating on shares of Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ:FB) in a report issued on Thursday morning. Jefferies Group currently has a $170.00 target price on the social networking company’s stock.

A number of other brokerages also recently weighed in on FB. Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (The) reissued a buy rating and set a $162.00 price target on shares of Facebook in a research report on Saturday, October 22nd. Wedbush restated an outperform rating and set a $162.00 price objective on shares of Facebook in a report on Friday, October 28th. Cantor Fitzgerald restated a buy rating and set a $160.00 price objective on shares of Facebook in a report on Monday, October 31st. MKM Partners restated a buy rating and set a $165.00 price objective on shares of Facebook in a report on Tuesday, November 1st. Finally, restated a buy rating on shares of Facebook in a report on Friday, September 23rd. One analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have issued a hold rating, forty-three have issued a buy rating and three have given a strong buy rating to the company. The stock presently has a consensus rating of Buy and an average price target of $150.27.

Shares of Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) opened at 127.87 on Thursday. Facebook has a 12-month low of $89.37 and a 12-month high of $133.50. The firm has a market capitalization of $368.54 billion, a PE ratio of 49.29 and a beta of 0.66. The company’s 50-day moving average price is $119.88 and its 200-day moving average price is $123.57.

Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) last announced its quarterly earnings results on Wednesday, November 2nd. The social networking company reported $1.09 earnings per share for the quarter, topping analysts’ consensus estimates of $0.97 by $0.12. The firm had revenue of $7 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $6.90 billion. Facebook had a return on equity of 16.51% and a net margin of 30.32%. The business’s revenue was up 55.8% compared to the same quarter last year. During the same quarter in the previous year, the business earned $0.57 earnings per share. Analysts anticipate that Facebook will post $4.10 EPS for the current year.

In related news, VP Colin Stretch sold 750 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction dated Tuesday, October 25th. The shares were sold at an average price of $132.69, for a total transaction of $99,517.50. Following the transaction, the vice president now owns 82,290 shares in the company, valued at $10,919,060.10. The sale was disclosed in a filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available through this link. Also, insider Christopher K. Cox sold 15,600 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction dated Monday, November 14th. The shares were sold at an average price of $115.83, for a total transaction of $1,806,948.00. Following the transaction, the insider now owns 379,068 shares in the company, valued at approximately $43,907,446.44. The disclosure for this sale can be found here. 19.08% of the stock is currently owned by corporate insiders.

Several institutional investors have recently made changes to their positions in the stock. CIBC World Markets Inc. boosted its position in shares of Facebook by 8.6% in the second quarter. CIBC World Markets Inc. now owns 139,450 shares of the social networking company’s stock valued at $15,936,000 after buying an additional 11,083 shares in the last quarter. Train Babcock Advisors LLC boosted its position in shares of Facebook by 1,113.7% in the second quarter. Train Babcock Advisors LLC now owns 29,626 shares of the social networking company’s stock valued at $3,386,000 after buying an additional 27,185 shares in the last quarter. W.G. Shaheen & Associates DBA Whitney & Co boosted its position in shares of Facebook by 15.2% in the second quarter. W.G. Shaheen & Associates DBA Whitney & Co now owns 6,600 shares of the social networking company’s stock valued at $754,000 after buying an additional 872 shares in the last quarter. Morgens Waterfall Vintiadis & Co. Inc. boosted its position in shares of Facebook by 64.5% in the second quarter. Morgens Waterfall Vintiadis & Co. Inc. now owns 51,000 shares of the social networking company’s stock valued at $5,828,000 after buying an additional 20,000 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Meyer Handelman Co. boosted its position in shares of Facebook by 7.2% in the second quarter. Meyer Handelman Co. now owns 7,400 shares of the social networking company’s stock valued at $846,000 after buying an additional 500 shares in the last quarter. Institutional investors own 56.16% of the company’s stock.

Facebook, Inc builds products that enable people to connect and share through mobile devices and personal computers. The Company enables people to share their opinions, ideas, photos and videos, and other activities. Its products include Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp and Oculus. Facebook is a mobile application and Website that enables people to connect, share, discover and communicate with each other on mobile devices and personal computers.
title: The Facebook, Inc. (FB) Rating Reiterated by Jefferies Group
